episodes 0.0.0.9000

Generate Cutoff Values for Treatment Gaps, Progression, and Death

Source: R/generate_cutoffs.R
generate_cutoffs.Rd

This function computes data-driven cutoff thresholds for defining:

  • the gap between treatment lines,

  • the time to progression after chemotherapy, and

  • the time to death in patients with only one line and a known progression.

Usage

generate_cutoffs(drug_episodes)

Arguments

drug_episodes

A data.frame of drug episodes, including columns: linestartdate, lineenddate, progression_date, death_date, and chemo_line.

Value

A list with three numeric cutoff values:

next_line_cutoff

Median number of days to next line of treatment

progression_cutoff

75th percentile of time to progression

death_cutoff

75th percentile of time to death among single-line patients

Details

These cutoffs are useful for labeling transitions (e.g., censoring vs. death vs. progression) in real-world oncology datasets.

The function calculates:

  • The next line cutoff as the 50th percentile (median) of days between end of one line and start of next.

  • The progression cutoff as the 75th percentile of time to progression from end of chemo line.

  • The death cutoff as the 75th percentile of time to death, calculated only for patients with a single line and a known progression date.

These thresholds can be used as rule-based criteria in modeling progression-free survival or treatment state transitions.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  cutoffs <- generate_cutoffs(drug_episodes)
  cutoffs$progression_cutoff
} # }
